page.title: 20Gala Day in Ingleton
page.content: For the adults there was a cheese and wine stall, a tombola where you bought a ticket and if the number on the ticket ended with a five or a nought you won a prize. There was a stall run by Ingleton Pottery where you could have a go at throwing your own pot using grey clay on a potters wheel, this cost 40p.There were ice cream stalls, hot dog stalls and pop and crisp stalls. There was a miniature London Bus and small children could go for a ride round the field. Children could have a horse ride on the Shetland pony. There was a hoop_la where for 20p you could have four hoops and try to land them over jars in which were prizes. The general entertainment was given by the clowns, the Pipe Band, the sheepdog trial and the main event, the crowning of the Gala Queen, Jennifer Bond.
